c74object.name: sp.shatter~
c74object.digest: Decompose a signal into components using NMF
c74object.description: Decompose a signal into components using Non-Negative Matrix Factorisation.
c74object.discussion: Open the Overview Patch The sp.shatter~ object takes audio input and decomposes it uses finely-tuned spectral contours that are optimised through machine learning. You can either seed bases directly in the object or load/read ones previous created with sp.shattercreate~.

outlet.description: Activation envelope output as multi-channel signal

objarg.name: default
objarg.digest: JSON file to load by default
objarg.description: JSON file to load by default.

method.name: load
method.description: Opens file dialog to select pre-decoposed shatter .json file.

method.name: print
method.digest: Print summary info to Max console
method.description: Prints a summary of the analysis to the Max console.

method.name: read
method.description: Reads a pre-decomposed shatter .json file directly from a relative or absolute path.

method.name: seed
method.digest: Enable recording for the internal NMF decomposition buffer~
method.description: Enable recording for the internal NMF decomposition buffer~.

attribute.name: attack
attribute.description: Attack time of activation envelope (in ms).

attribute.name: components
attribute.digest: Amount of components for the internal seeding
attribute.description: Amount of components for the internal seeding (not required when loading an analysis).

attribute.name: decay
attribute.description: Decay time of activation envelope (in ms).

attribute.name: fftsettings
attribute.description: FFT settings consist of three numbers representing the window size, hop size and FFT size in samples: The hop size and fft size can both be set to -1 (and are by default), with slightly different meanings: For the hop size, -1 = windowsize/2 For the FFT size, -1 = windowsize snapped to the nearest equal / greater power of 2 (e.g. windowsize 1024 => fftsize 1024, but windowssize 1000 also => fftsize 1024) Constraints FFTSize, if != -1, will snap to the next greatest power of two if FFT size != -1, then window size is clipped at FFT size

attribute.name: history
attribute.digest: The size of the history window for smoothing the list output
attribute.description: The size of the history window for smoothing the list output.

attribute.name: transpose
attribute.digest: Amount to shift the spectral contours over
attribute.description: Amount to shift the spectral contours over (0-100%).
